meanings.definition: A distinct section of a piece of writing, typically dealing with a single theme and indicated by a new line, indentation, or numbering.
meanings.sent1: In the story, each of the paragraphs focused on a different character's adventure.
meanings.sent2: When I write an essay, I always make sure to include multiple paragraphs to organize my thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The paragraphs in the book were like little islands of information waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library, with paragraphs of memories neatly arranged on the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of using paragraphs to structure our writing clearly.

meanings.definition: To divide a piece of writing into paragraphs.
meanings.sent1: She paragraphs her essays to make them easier to read and understand.
meanings.sent2: When you write a letter, remember to paragraph it so that it looks neat.
meanings.sent3: The student decided to play a prank by randomly paragraphing his friend's report.
meanings.sent4: His speech was so captivating that it felt like he could paragraph the silence with his words.
meanings.sent5: As she typed, she would often pause to paragraph her thoughts before continuing.
